om.stdquestion
Class QComponent

java.lang.Object
  om.stdquestion.QComponent
Direct Known Subclasses:
AdvancedFieldComponent, AudioComponent, BoxComponent, BreakComponent, ButtonComponent, CanvasComponent, CentreComponent, CheckboxComponent, DragBoxComponent, DropBoxComponent, DropdownComponent, EditFieldComponent, EmphasisComponent, EquationComponent, FlashComponent, GapComponent, IfComponent, ImageComponent, IndentComponent, JMEComponent, LabelComponent, LayoutGridComponent, LinkComponent, ListComponent, RadioBoxComponent, RightComponent, RootComponent, TableComponent, TextComponent, TextEquationComponent, WordSelectComponent
public abstract class QComponent
extends java.lang.Object

Base class for question components.

QComponent

public QComponent()
Method Detail

init

public void init(QComponent parent,
                 QDocument qd,
                 org.w3c.dom.Element eThis,
                 boolean bImplicit)
          throws OmException
Initialises from a particular XML element.

Default implementation sets properties (unless the component is implicit in which case it doesn't have properties) and sets up the owner document. It then calls initChildren() and finally initSpecific().

If you override this, you must call superclass version first otherwise document won't get set and things will break.

Parameters:
parent - The parent component.
qd - Document within which this QComponent resides
eThis - Element that provides the contents of this component
bImplicit - True if this component doesn't actually have its own parent element and eThis belongs to some other component
Throws:
OmException - If whatever error occurs

initChildren

protected void initChildren(org.w3c.dom.Element eThis)
                     throws OmException
Initialises children based on the given XML element.

This default implementation treats all child elements as components. If you want to include text as well or treat elements differently (if they have a specific meaning for your components) you need to override this method. QDocument.buildInside() and similar will be useful; or you may wish to call initAsText.

Parameters:
eThis - XML element representing this component
Throws:
OmException - If there's an error initialising the children

initSpecific

protected void initSpecific(org.w3c.dom.Element eThis)
                     throws OmException
Carries out initialisation specific to component. Override this method if you need any. Default does nothing.

Parameters:
eThis - XML element representing this component
Throws:
OmException - If there's an error

initAsText

protected void initAsText(org.w3c.dom.Element eThis)
                   throws OmException
Designed for calling from an override of initChildren. Treats the contents of this element as if they are within a text component.

Parameters:
eThis - Element
Throws:
OmException - If there's an error initialising any children

getApproximatePixelSize

public java.awt.Dimension getApproximatePixelSize()
                                           throws OmDeveloperException
Optional override to estimate pixel size of the component. This is useful for components which expect to be placed within equations or graphs. Components that implement this method (to do anything other than return null) MUST also implement forcewidth and forceheight

Default returns null.

Returns:
Pixel size if known, or null
Throws:
OmDeveloperException

protected QDocument getQDocument()
Returns:
QDocument that this component is within

getQuestion

protected StandardQuestion getQuestion()
Returns:
StandardQuestion that owns this component

getParent

protected QComponent getParent()
Returns:
Parent component or null if this is root

getAncestors

protected QComponent[] getAncestors()
Returns:
Array of ancestors. Array element 0 is parent, 1 is parent's parent, etc

findAncestor

protected QComponent findAncestor(java.lang.Class<? extends QComponent> cType)
Parameters:
cType - Desired class of ancestor
Returns:
The nearest ancestor of that class, or null if none

getChildBackground

protected java.awt.Color getChildBackground(QComponent qcChild)
Returns the background colour of the nearest ancestor that has a background colour. Components which set a background should override this.

Parameters:
qcChild - Child that's asking or null if we're looking for background of this component itself.
Returns:
The colour.

getBackground

protected final java.awt.Color getBackground()
Returns background colour of this component. Actually just calls getChildBackground(null). If changing background colour, override getChildBackground and not this.

Returns:
The colour.

wantsFilledChildren

protected boolean wantsFilledChildren()
Some layout components want children to fill their allotted spaces by setting height and width to 100%.

Returns:
Default is false

shouldFillParent

protected boolean shouldFillParent()
If this returns true, child should set height and width to 100% or otherwise try to fill its parent (where possible)

Returns:
True if parent wantsFilledChildren.

produceOutput

public void produceOutput(QContent qc,
                          boolean bInit,
                          boolean bPlain)
                   throws OmException
Build up current content of this component that should end up in the question output.

Default implementation just calls produceVisibleOutput() if 'display' is true.

Parameters:
qc - Output variable that accepts question content
bInit - True if this is first call in question initialisation
bPlain - True if in plain mode
Throws:
OmException - If whatever error occurs

produceVisibleOutput

protected void produceVisibleOutput(QContent qc,
                                    boolean bInit,
                                    boolean bPlain)
                             throws OmException
Builds up content of this component that should end up in question output. Only called if the 'display' property is set to true.

Default implementation just calls produceChildOutput().

Parameters:
qc - Output variable that accepts question content
bInit - True if this is first call in question initialisation
Throws:
OmException - If whatever error occurs

addLangAttributes

protected void addLangAttributes(org.w3c.dom.Element e)
                          throws OmDeveloperException
If the lang property has been set, add a corresponding lang attribute to the given HTML element, and also add lang-en-gb (or whatever) to the class attribute.

Parameters:
e - The element to add the attributes to.
Throws:
OmDeveloperException

getCSS

public java.lang.String getCSS(boolean bFirstInstance)
                        throws OmException
Called on question init to produce the CSS needed in a question that includes this component. Happens after init() but before produceOutput()

Default implementation looks for a CSS file with same name as class and returns that; or returns null if not first instance.

This method calls convertCSS to process the CSS file so that it may contain special commands.

Not called when question is in plain mode. Plain mode questions may not include CSS.

Parameters:
bFirstInstance - True if this is the first instance of this class of component
Returns:
CSS to include for this component or null if none
Throws:
OmException - Any error

convertCSS

protected java.lang.String convertCSS(java.lang.String sInput)
                               throws OmDeveloperException
Converts a CSS file ready for output, by filling in templated colours and sizes from the accessibility controls.
Command formatResult
%%COLOUR:text%%Actual colour e.g. #ff3321 (Constants are those supported by convertHash, convertRGB)
%%SIZE:16px%%Converted size e.g. 24px

Parameters:
sInput - CSS file as loaded
Returns:
Resulting file with all special control commands processed
Throws:
OmDeveloperException - If there are invalid commands in the CSS

getJS

public java.lang.String getJS(boolean bFirstInstance)
                       throws OmException
Called on question init to produce the JS needed in a question that includes this component. Happens after init() but before produceOutput()

Default implementation looks for a JS file with same name as class and returns that; or returns null if not first instance.

Not called when question is in plain mode. Plain mode questions may not include JS.

Parameters:
bFirstInstance - True if this is the first instance of this class of component
Returns:
JS to include for this component or null if none
Throws:
OmException - Any error

formSetValue

protected void formSetValue(java.lang.String sValue,
                            ActionParams ap)
                     throws OmException
On receiving this call, the component should update its internal data structures based on the given value from XHTML.

Called automatically by framework after receiving a form, when an item in the action parameters begins with QDocument.VALUE_PREFIX.

Default implementation throws exception; suitable for components that have no value such as buttons. Consequently, do not call base class when overriding.

Parameters:
sValue - Value string for this item
ap - All parameters (needed if this item uses more than one)
Throws:
OmException - If overriders need to.

formAllValuesSet

protected void formAllValuesSet(ActionParams ap)
                         throws OmException
On receiving this call, the component knows that if it hasn't received a formSetValue then its value was not submitted in the current form submission.

All components receive this call after each form submit. The default implementation does nothing.

Parameters:
ap - All form parameters
Throws:
OmException - If overriders need to

formCallAction

protected void formCallAction(java.lang.String sValue,
                              ActionParams ap)
                       throws OmException
On receiving this call, the component should pass on its action to an appropriate action handler in the question.

Called automatically by framework after receiving a form, when an item in the action parameters begins with QDocument.ACTION_PREFIX. The call happens after all calls to formSetValue, so you can rely on the value of this and all other components without needing to example the ActionParams.

Default implementation throws exception; suitable for components that have no action such as input boxes. Consequently, do not call base class when overriding.

Parameters:
sValue - Value string from the form item
ap - All parameters
Throws:
OmException

defineProperty

protected void defineProperty(java.lang.String sName,
                              java.lang.Class<?> cType,
                              boolean bAllowFromXML,
                              java.lang.String sRestriction)
                       throws OmDeveloperException
Define a property which this component supports. Once defined, the property can be set using setProperty, retrieved by getProperty methods, etc.

Parameters:
sName - Property name (should generally be all lower-case)
cType - Java class of property (String.class, Integer.class, Boolean.class, or Double.class)
bAllowFromXML - True if it should be interpreted from XML attribute of same name
sRestriction - Additional restriction regex (used only when reading from xml); may be null
Throws:
OmDeveloperException - If you've tried to allow a property from XML that isn't one of the standard classes.

defineProperties

protected void defineProperties()
                         throws OmDeveloperException
Intended for overriding. Default allows 'id' and 'display', so do remember to call superclass if you override or you won't get these.

Basically call defineProperty a bunch of times to set up all your properties. If you wish to set initial property values you can do that here too.

Throws:
OmDeveloperException

produceChildOutput

protected void produceChildOutput(QContent qc,
                                  boolean bInit,
                                  boolean bPlain)
                           throws OmException
Calls produceOutput for each child, adding their content to the given question content object. Text children get added directly.

Parameters:
qc - Output variable that accepts question content
bInit - True if this is first call in question initialisation
Throws:
OmException - If whatever error occurs

getID

public java.lang.String getID()
                       throws OmDeveloperException
Obtains a unique ID for component. If one wasn't specified, an automatically generated one based on the position within the xml document will be used.

Returns:
Unique ID for component
Throws:
OmDeveloperException

                     throws OmDeveloperException

setEnabled

public void setEnabled(boolean bEnabled)
Parameters:
bEnabled - True to enable all editing components within this, false to disable

setDisplay

public void setDisplay(boolean bDisplay)
Parameters:
bDisplay - True to display this component

setDisplayOnComponentsWithId

public void setDisplayOnComponentsWithId(boolean bDisplay,
                                         java.lang.String idPrefix)
Calls setDisplay on this component and all its descendants that have an id explicitly set in the question XML, and where that ID starts with idPrefix. For example, you might want to call this to hide all components with an id starting with "feedback" to hide all the different bits of feedback, before selectively redisplaying just those bits that are relevant to the answer the student just entered.

Parameters:
bDisplay - passed to setDisplay on each matching component.
idPrefix - the prefix an elements id must start with for it to be affected, for example "feedback". To match all children with an id, use "".

isDisplayed

public boolean isDisplayed()
Returns:
True if display is on

isChildDisplayed

public boolean isChildDisplayed()
Returns:
True if display is on for one or more children.

isEnabled

public boolean isEnabled()
Returns:
True if currently enabled (checks all parents up the tree)

Returns:

Throws:

convertHash

public java.lang.String convertHash(java.lang.String sColour)
                             throws OmDeveloperException
Given a colour, returns the 3/6-digit HTML # version.

Parameters:
sColour - Colour (either #rgb, #rrggbb, or colour constant)
Returns:
#rgb or #rrggbb
Throws:
OmDeveloperException

convertHash

interColour

public java.lang.String interColour(double weight)
                             throws OmDeveloperException
Returns a weighted intermediate between the question foreground and background colours as # version.

Parameters:
weight - (=1 returns background, =0 returns foregound)
Returns:
#rgb or #rrggbb
Throws:
OmDeveloperException

Parameters:

Returns:
Byte array of data from file
Throws:
OmDeveloperException - If the file doesn't exist etc.
